page.title: 06LARGE FARMING METHODS
page.content: Mr. Hughie Bachelor is a well known local character and farmer. He lives at Thurnham Court, near the church. He took over from his father, H.D. Bachelor, the running of 5000 acres of land stretching from the Pilgrims Way to Hollingbourne and including much of Thurnham. He uses modern farming methods requiring large machinery and huge fields. For all these acres he employs just 15 men on a regular basis. His crops include oilseed rape and peas. The 700 acres of peas yield 2.6 tons per acre. The peas are shelled by his own machinery and are intended for freezing. Local people can buy peas for freezing on site. He owns a number of local cottages and is a Parish Councillor.
